dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small potted plant, a Ginkgo tree, sits in a Japanese u

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know that many people believe in fate, and trust me, there are times I wish I was one of them. Pan off to the open door of a bathroom where MAYA DAVILLA 42, pretty, fit, stands under a running shower.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I tend to think our lives are shaped by a series of choices; one decision leading to another and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya combs out her hair in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: As far as I can tell, it’s the journey through all these decisions that paints the clearest portrait of who we really are. Her boyfriend, TREY EVERS, 38, enters with avocado toast a candle on it.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Birthday breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Love breakfast. Hate birthdays. (kissing him) Love you, though.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: How bout a little more. She takes a bite of toast.

dialogues.speaker: TREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t talking about the food. She smiles, drops her towel, and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya sits at the vanity, hair extensions in, blowing on h nail polish.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You look hot.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I need to look professional.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You do... Relax, okay. Everybody there loves you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You need a bachelors degree to be a manager.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: I’d argue fifteen years experience is worth ten degrees, not to mention the Bernie Millman seal of approval.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you... (smiles; he always knows what to say) We need to move your car. She heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya gets her bags then stops to rub her fingers on a lea the Gingko tree. Speaks under her breath--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I need you today, abuela. Trey enters, dressed...

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: It’s they who need you more than you need them.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m taking it one game at a time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs h.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Did you just sports metaphor me? (he loves it) Just keep your eye on the ball.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What if Weiskopf doesn’t like me?

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: It's a game of inches. Give it a hundred and ten percent.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’m ignoring you... Do you like, it's an honor to meet you Mr. Weiskopf, or does that sound too--

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Ass kissy.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I have to get this, Trey.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: C'mere. (wrapping her in a hug) You're Maya Davilla. The only thing with a prayer of stopping you, is you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (then) I'm going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Knock ‘em dead. is keys and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Your ass looks great in those jeans by the way.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: (playfully offended) Sweetie, no. I am not a piece of meat. What? Again? I‘m not in the-- (approaches her) Okay. But we’ll have to make it quick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (giggles) Go! She takes a minute collecting her things, herself. EXT. MAYA AND TREY’S APARTMENT - DAY 5) Maya walks out to her ‘95 Ford Fiesta, rehearsing as she INT. MAYA’S CAR - DAY 6 Maya practices her pitch as she drives through the Queens neighborhood streets.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: To stand out in the big box community, we knew we had to do things differently. Maya stops at a light and looks over as a Mercedes SL pul up next to her. She admires the car, even as the business woman in the front seat snaps orders into a phone, then p away as the light changes. INT. BODACIOUS BODEGA - DAY a Maya enters, still rehearsing under her breath. She grabs wrapped ham and egg from a spot beneath a small, plastic tree bearing a faded sign that reads: MAYA’S H&M.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thanks, Justin.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (behind the counter) You got it, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya crosses the street and sits on a wooden city bench beneath a tree. Her world seems to slow as she eats meditatively. When she’s done, she ritualistically rubs her hand back a forth across the pommel of the left arm rest before foldi the sandwich paper and, with a deep breath--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Let’s do this.  10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya pulls into the huge parking lot. She climbs out and joins the dozens of others walking tow work at the giant warehouse market that is VALUE CLUB. COSTCO by another name.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's an honor, Mr. Weiskopf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMUEL WEISKOPF, 72, CEO of VALUE CLUB, stands with, a yo man in a bow tie, ARTHUR COYLE, 27 fastidious, southern preppie, and store manager, BERNARD MILLMAN, 70's.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: .--to show you what we’ve been doing at VALUE CLUB, 151.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: The honor is ours. (introducing) My associate Arthur Coyle. Take note, Arthur, Forest Hills Value Club outsells it’s nearest competition twice over.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Two and a half times, but who’s counting.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: We are. Let’s show him why, Maya... Maya walks with Bernie, Weiskopf, and Arthur through the enormous warehouse of food, electronics, household suppli

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It’s no secret the challenge for brick and mortars are the online outlets, the Amazons, eBay's...

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: So we started to think, how do we fight them...

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: And?  11

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Welcome to our online store. Three staffers sit at desks with iPads and head sets fulfilling phone orders. ON THE COMPUTER: We see Value Club’s well stocked aisles. MAYA (CONT’D) It’s what sets us apart. Wasn’t it you sir who said, “We live ina multiple universe”?

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: In your last newsletter. So, my best friend, Joan Viccidommini, fellow employee, sends her son, Dilly, into the store with his cellphone so he can hold up every single cut of sirloin for her Beef Braciole, and that’s when it hits me.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (browsing the site) It's a live feed. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: From home, our subscribers can pick an exact filet of salmon, the third lemon from the back, anything they need. They shop before noon, we deliver by six. Twenty mile radius. Expands our community. Expands our volume.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: And expands our profits nicely.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Anyone thirsty?  12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Located at the back of the store. A few early shoppers st at the coffee bar beneath the sign that reads: TRIPLE M C

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Triple M? WOMAN’S VOICE Monday. Morning. Moms. Everyone turns to see JOAN VICCIDOMINI, 30's, Maya's best friend. She’s colorful both in language and dress.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Meet the aforementioned Joan...

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (to Maya) Now? (Maya nods) Okay, so I have three kids and a husband on disability, and I was, you know, “Sharing my woes” with a few other mothers, and Maya thought we should start a weekly bitch fest-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: --a social club. Catering to the Monday Morning Moms or Dads. It started small, the hour after AM school drop off--

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: We vent. We shop. We vent.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And it just grew.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Are we talking staff or customers?

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
dialogues.text: Maya looks shocked as a short, squat, woman, SUZI TEPLITS late 30's walks over. Tight pants, lots of jewelry, make

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Suzi’s here?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: For seasoning. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SuzI I call it Value Club Therapy - we're like shopping friends. We swap stories, recipes... Another triple M member, Antonella Denunzio ("Big Ant”), big voice, big boobs, overweight, tight clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Husbands...

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You wish.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: This moisturizer sucks, that one’s overpriced, the rotisserie chicken’s as dry as my--

dialogues.speaker: SUZI
dialogues.text: --and that’s why they got rid of ait

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Along with all the crappy skin care stuff. The point is, these ladies listen to us. suzrI Like it’s our store too.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And that about sums it up.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say. Other than, Arthur’s going to be extremely fortunate to have you as a first Lieutenant. The news hits Maya hard. Now she knows why Arthur's there WEISKOPF (CONT’D) (walking off) I’ll leave you guys to get to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (calls out) Mr. Weiskopf. (he turns) Could I have a moment? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bernard looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: You can have two.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you, ummm I prepared for this meeting for many weeks. I didn’t sleep last night or all week, actually.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: You did great, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’ve put fifteen years of my life into this store, and, since becoming assistant manager 6 years ago, sales have increased at a record pace. (she looks at Arthur) I mean, no disrespect, but what do you know about this store or the customers who shop here?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (smarmy ) I specialize at team building.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Arthur’s MBA is from Duke. I think you'll find that he’s the best man for the job.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: No sir. I am.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Where did you go to college, dear?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I have my G.E.D.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Well, I respect that. I do. But we have minimum job requirements in place for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And what is that reason? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: (shutting this down) I want you to know how much we value you, your ideas, and your loyalty. Off Maya as Weiskopf walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya has her head down. Joan comes in.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: It’s just a title.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It's everything.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: It’s one thing. Perspective. You've got Trey, hello amazing boyfriend. You know he’s ring shopping, right? (off Maya) Oops.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why would you tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: I said, “oops.” And hellloooo, after five years together, this can’t be a shocker.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It’s not about-- He wants kids.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: And that’s bad because...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We're not talking about this right now.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: News flash. You're forty-two. Correction, forty-three today. (off Maya) But we can call you forty-two. Who even knows if you can still get pregnant? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Wow, and I thought I felt bad ten minutes ago. (then) I wanted that job, Joanie.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: How do I say this nicely? I don’t... Get sloshed, and get knocked up after the party tonight. You can use the guest bedroom, and--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Wait, what party?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Oops?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to be a surprise. Trey talked us into it. You can’t say no.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Plus Dilly’s leaving for California soon. If you don’t want to celebrate you, celebrate him. Just do me one favor. Act surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: INT. JOAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT 14 Blue collar, lived in, split level. Decorated for a birth

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Joan told me this morning. Everyone glares at Joan.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Bitch.  m5 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing until Trey steps to the center the living room and quiets everyone...

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: If we could pipe down for a second...Thank you...I’d like to tell you all a couple’a things about the birthday girl. Joan takes Maya’s arm...

dialogues.speaker: TREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back when I coached Babe Ruth League--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh, here we go.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: There was this Friday night game at Pezzicola Field. This one kid-- (points at DILLY) --goes down on a called third strike and suddenly there’s this shrieking from the stands. Some crazy lady’s all over the ump. (waving her off) In fairness, she wasn’t wrong; the guy was dropping more calls than AT&T. But she wasn’t letting up. So I turn to get a look at this wacko, and bam, that was it for me. She was beautiful and brazen and completely on fire, and anyone who doesn’t appreciate how amazing she is... Well, babe, just remember, it ain’t over ‘til it’s over. Happy birthday. Everyone oooh, and ahhs, as Maya embraces, Trey.

dialogues.speaker: TREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (indicating the music) Dilly. DILLY, Joan’s son, 18, eccentric, skateboarder tech-geniu puts on Luther Vandross’ SUPERSTAR. Trey and Maya dance slowly and others join in. A real par  13). 16 EXT. JOAN’S BACKYARD - LATER 16 Maya and Joan sit outside sharing what’s left of a bottle champagne.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I’m so upset.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It’s just... I guess I let myself believe they’d give me a shot.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Who would?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Them. The “educated” people in their big houses and fancy cars who, I don’t know, climb Kilimanjaro and only drink Rose.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Them.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: System's rigged... Doesn’t it bother you that just because you couldn’t go to college when you were eighteen, you can’t qualify for a job when you're forty?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Given where you were at eighteen, I’d say you’ve come a very long way.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Days like this, it doesn’t feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: It’s different now. The opportunities, I mean, a child from my loins is going to Stanford, on a Google scholarship. My son. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 ny

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He's been He hands M 14. Close on Maya. Shakes her

dialogues.text: Maya, sits 16

dialogues.text: Well, we’re sending him with a truckload of condoms, last thing we need is for his life to go off the rails like mine did.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You mean Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (nods ) I just wonder how different things would have been if she was still with me. Neither one of us really had a chance.

dialogues.speaker: DILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s tons of other jobs out there, Auntie M. listening from the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Quit eavesdropping. She’s not going anywhere. And there will be no truckload of condoms. aya a piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: DILLY
dialogues.text: One wish for your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I wish... head, fights off tears...

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You did the best you could.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I gave it a hundred and ten percent.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB
dialogues.text: with a few other assistant managers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: I’ve always liked the idea of round tables. As a boy, my favorite stories were-- her eyes, Arthur clocks it. ARTHUR (CONT’D) Ms. Davilla, a minute. (steering her away) I‘m aware you wanted this position, and what's more I sincerely believe you deserved it. For me this is just a springboard into corporate. But I promise you this, when I get there, I'm going to take a long hard look at any policies that keep— out someone with your... (searching for the word) .+.-temerity.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Temerity?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: It means spunk.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yes. Your ideas, while rough, still have merit.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What’s rough about them?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: But when you roll your eyes at me, you are trivializing a team building exercise that I'm trying to implement. And that divides us. (then) I don’t want to be the despot ruler forced to replace old regimes. You’re my right hand, and we're all at the same table. her back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As I was saying, I'd like us to think of ourselves as knights... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR (CONT’D) Each with our own wisdom and fiefdoms. So, Sir Vondell Girard, you are our knight of legumes, and Sir Alex Gibian, knight of fowl. Joan appears at the door. Gesturing. ARTHUR (CONT’D) And Shaniqua Hughes--You are the Knight of Hummus.

dialogues.text: (confused) Um, I run the dairy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand by the opened door.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I can’t take this much longer.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Good timing... (handing her a note) Some lady from Franklin and Clarke called for you.

dialogues.speaker: F

dialogues.text: Ah. Don’t worry. I intercepted, no one knows.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Actually, I think Dilly did. Last week when you were all, “I wish this, and I wish that.”

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Relax. He used your legal... Maria de la Rosalinda de la whatever name, and put you up for some jobs.

dialogues.text: I didn’t ask him to.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: So blow it off. Become the knight of laxatives. Off Maya.

dialogues.text: Maya with hoops, hair, Queens flavor, but not too over th top, approaches the imposing Chrysler Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed. Maya sees other candidates half her age dressed m conservatively, waiting. She eyes them, they her, as she walks to the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Maya Davilla. The receptionist checks her computer.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, it’s under Maria Vargas. I got a call from a Miss Lipton...

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Your interview’s on the 59th Floor. Off Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Zen-like lobby with Feng-Shui rock fountain and muted colors. Even the phones whisper. Maya’s heels echo as she walks to the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m--

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Miss. Vargas. Yes, they're expecting you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: They are? INT. ANDERSON CLARKE’S OFFICE - 59TH FLOOR - SAME Views for days, Maya is led in by the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you Maria. 18. 21 22 Reveal, ANDERSON CLARKE, late 50's, affability born of supreme confidence; he’s been wearing a suit his entire l

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Please call me Maya.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Anderson Clarke.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: As in Franklin and Clarke?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: I wanted it to be Clarke and Franklin, but I lost a coin toss. Still pisses me off. This is Zoe, one of our senior executives. ZOE (mid-20‘s), cooly professional as she shakes Maya’s h

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: I recognize that this is a bit unorthodox, but I’ve long thought that sales should have a greater voice in product development.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You’re familiar with our products?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Company wide?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Dazzle us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s see... In personal care, the Mountain Rain Shampoo’s excellent, though we only stock the regular version. Men's shaving gel, Fresh and Bright Toothpaste are big sellers, although the entire skin- care line is...

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (trying/failing to soft- pedal) Careless. You're far behind the competition. Zoe's eyebrows go up, but Anderson, slightly bemused, for her to stand down.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (pivoting) Um... Your detergents fly off the shelves, oh, and the new Paraffin Dusting Spray is--

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (heard enough) Your credentials are certainly impressive. (reads a file) Harvard undergrad? Wharton B- school...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Um-—?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: And your philanthropy, all the work with the homeless, two years in the Peace Corps. And then there’s--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (confused) I’m sorry but...

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Surely you have summit pictures? 19}. 22 motions (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Summit pictures?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Mr. Clarke has been training to climb Kilimanjaro.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Is that right? Actually, I don’t have any--

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Except on Facebook.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Except on...Facebook.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: The breadth of your experience is what's impressed us most.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You’re currently consulting for Value Club?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: M-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Sam Weiskopf is an old friend of mine. Know him?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Not really. I’m mostly focused on products; what works, what doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: What F&C product doesn’t work? Other than skin-care?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I don’t think we need Ms. Vargas to tell us--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: --Cherry-scented floor-polish.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: One of our best sellers.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Not anymore. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And not in the tri-state area.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Why do you think that is, Maya?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It’s more of a seasonal--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: People only buy what they need.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: People don’t know what they need until they see it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: If people needed their floors to smell like cherries, I wouldn’t have had to RMA thirty-six unsold cases back to your distributor. Point. Counter point. Zoe, unreadable considers.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Thanks for coming in, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What the hell? Was this guy on Hildy’s list?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: We've gone through her list. This is my idea. They share a look and stop at a door with light coming fr beneath the crack. Another shared look before Maya opens INT. CHASE’S LAB - NIGHT 43 The sound of mewing hits us first. Cats in cages. Cats on play structures.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Wait, no! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CHASE ISKOWITZ, 28, disheveled, adds slices of chicken to blender filled with other mystery meats and powders. He r after a pair of cats that escape through the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daenerys and Cercei, get your little butts back here-- Dammit! Maya slowly turns to Ariana, who smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase sits across the table from Maya and Ariana. He pick a plate filled with mashed potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So, you went from M.I.T. to developing cat food.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Maybe I like cats.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: (to Maya) Or maybe Felix exiled him.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Maybe Felix is an ass-panda. Ariana catches his eye, pointing to her face. He’s got a of potato above his lip. He wipes the wrong spot.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Well, he joined up with Zoe. Ariana shakes her head, points again. Chase wipes, smeari the potato across his lip like a pencil-thin mustache.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Everyone joined up with Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Except you. Is that because of Felix? Chase just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: So here’s your chance to beat his punk ass. She reaches across and wipes the potato from his face. Bo he and Maya are startled. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: (looking for a place to wipe her hand off) Gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and Maya get out of a cab with Maya’s suitcases. May checks the address and looks up at the renovated building

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yup. INT. MAYA’S NEW APARTMENT - FOYER - NIGHT 46 The elevator opens to the 15th floor, and her apartment. elevator man helps her with her bags.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR MAN
dialogues.text: Welcome home. With sight-lines for both rivers. The furnishings are exquisite. Maya and Joan start walking around, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Screw the kids, I’m moving in with you. (off Maya’s look) They can learn to hunt or something.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What am I doing here? The CEO’s taking a risk on me, and yet he’s got me competing against his daughter, who already hates me. And all of them think I’m someone else. Joan has wandered into the kitchen. She opens the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Holy frick, you cannot back out now. They stocked the fridge with beer. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Holy frick?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Otto got sent home yesterday for calling his teacher a dunt.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: A dumb--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh wow.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m endeavoring to set a better example. She hands Maya a beer. They sip together, taking in the v across the Hudson River...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Him? (off Maya’s look) Oh, Trey. Have I. Uh, maybe, I don’t really--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What are you not telling me?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. You know how it is. Word gets out you guys broke up. He’s a wounded fish, and the sharks start circling.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Already?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: What does it matter, you ended it?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: He ended it.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: He wants a family, and you never told him the truth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So telling him I’m screwed up because I gave my baby up for adoption when I was seventeen is gonna fix everything?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Oh, right - it’s way better to lug your past around like a cross and bury your self-esteem in your career than ever forgive yourself for things that happened when you were practically a child. Maya drops into the couch, conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, oh. Look what I’ve done. I’ve put you in a funk and I haven't even made you mad at me for jumping on your princess bed. 45. 46 Joan giggles and runs off to find the bedroom. Maya doesn want to take the bait, but can’t help herself. Chases her

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 She’s drawing on her iPad which is hooked up to a large screen on the wall as Hildy and Chase look on.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s start with our goal: (writes) “Face cream. Moisturizer. Sun block.” It’s gotta be one hundred percent organic.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: (hits him) It has to be profitable. Maya writes “profitable”. HILDY (CONT’D) And it needs to fill a hole in the market. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maya writes “fill hole in market.”

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in the hall) It needs a ‘wow’ factor.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Why are you in the hall?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: (eyes down) I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: It’s not important.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: The ‘wow’ factor or the reason she’s in the hall?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We need to approach this holistically. What do people really want?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: To be young?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: To be thin.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: To be loved. Surprised by this, Ariana looks up at the back of his hea

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Great, let’s invent a product that makes people, young, thin, and lovable....

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, and rich. They want to be rich.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Ok, where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floor to ceiling skin-care products; anything and everyth with myriad variations. Hildy leads down the rows... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: These are all the moisturizers... face creams... sun blocks... on the market.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Lotta dry skin out there.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: I’1ll have research put together a data package to show us the top sellers in each sector.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: It’s standard procedure in launching any new line.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I think we need to be IN the stores, talking to the managers, looking at sell throughs, rates of returns if we’re going to find a hole in the market.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: That’s going to eat up a lot of time and we only have twelve weeks. From behind them we hear--

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maya? Are you in here?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Mr. Clarke! Anderson appears around an aisle.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: There you are. Brushing up on the competition?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What? Yes. We’re brainstorming to-- Anyway, what can we do for you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We like to have a little fun on the weekends and thought you might like to join us at the river. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The river?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: That’s where our rowing club is. Since you coxed at Harvard, I thought you might show us a thing or two. Off Maya, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe sits at the end of her 8 man boat. Ron is in the stro position facing her. Felix behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: This should be interesting.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I loathe this. On the shore, Ariana and Hildy watch.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: This is so exciting. (off Hildy’s stare) Say less?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (calls out to her crew) On the feather! Maya, terrified as the coxswain, tries to mimic her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: On the feather! Anderson sits facing her in the stroke position, Chase ri behind him. Anderson smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Now this is what I call team building. A little friendly competition to get the creative juices flowing.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: My juices certainly are... (off Anderson’s look) Flowing... Sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Chase, sir. I’m on Maya's project team... I was in cat food.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. (then to Maya) Zoe rowed lightweight for Princeton. Never could beat you Crimson when she was there. Said you guys always had their number.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Well, we’ll see if we still have the old Crimson magic. Zoe settles her team just before the gun.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Sit ready!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (straining to hear) Shit’s ready!

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (bit between his teeth) Damn right it is! Shall we Power twenty from the start?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (nods, trepidatious) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Ready all... Maya pauses. The gun goes off.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Row!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Row! Power twenty! The crew accelerates 20 strokes at maximum effort. A bold move that sends Maya’s team into the lead, to her surprise. Zoe and Ron look over at Maya guiding her team into the l (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: They're pulling ahead.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Damnit, Zoe!

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (pissed) I’ve got this. Maya gets caught up in the exhilaration.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (smiles, sotto) I’ve got this. Boats go out of frame as we CUT TO BLACK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a paramedic truck is parked with its cherries flash A couple of rowers have ice packs on their knees, heads, Everyone is wet, in towels. Ariana and Hildy approach.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I so did not have that.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (lying) It's okay. We’ve had worse. In the background, several of Zoe’s team carry the broken HALF of their skull past camera.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: That was cray-cray. Anderson, Zoe, Ron and Felix approach, each drying off wi towel.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Where to begin?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I can think of a couple of places. EXT. HARLEM RIVER - FLASHBACK Sith Maya’s boat grazes a metal buoy, shearing off all the oar

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: It’s funny, I thought I heard you call ‘pull port’ as something different.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe yells through her megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Pull port!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Pulled pork.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You want us to pull port?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: To the right?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yes. The boat shifts to the right.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The other right! Zoe and Ron look right just in time to see the impact of Maya’s boat slicing theirs in two. Bodies, oars and up-ended rowers splash into the river.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It was hard to hear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Yes, over all the screaming.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I just want to apolog-- Anderson politely holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: --I just have one thing to say. Zoe, Ron and Felix can’t wait for this. ANDERSON (CONT’D) That. Was. Hilarious! Anderson chuckles and pops the tops off of two bottles of beer on the edge of a picnic table and offers them to May and Chase.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (bugged) But Mr. Clarke, that skull was--

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: --a piece of crap. Now we have an excuse to upgrade. (then, as he walks) See you tomorrow, guys. God I hope someone video’d that. That was some crazy shit. Chase gets up as well and leaves with Ariana and Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE/ARIANA
dialogues.text: See ya, Maya./Bye.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Okay. Ron sizes up Maya as he and Felix walk off. Then, quietly

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Coxswain my ass.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Exactly. First we gotta work for his daughter, now we get this one... Something’s bullshit about her. Back at the tables, Maya looks at Zoe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She trails 53.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Your dad is...unique.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: He is that... He’s brilliant and competitive to the point of occasional insanity, but it’s made him who he is. off, Maya reading her concern...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You worry about him?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I worry about some of his decisions. Maya smiles at the reference...

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Especially since my mother passed away.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Six years he hasn’t been on a date or a single vacation, although I finally talked him into selling the apartment. But still, he’s always on me about having more of a life outside of work, and yet he can’t see the same about himself.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I lost my parents young... My grandmother raised me until she died... After that I ended up bouncing around foster care, which was...tough.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Is that why you never married or had kids?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: When you come out of that, there’s a lack of confidence that’s implanted in you, and you’d never risk making someone else feel as unwanted as you did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Which makes all of your accomplishments that much more impressive. Maya accepts the kindness, but cringes inside at the lie.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, now that we’ve Oprah’d each other, I’ve got a big day tomorrow - first shot at initial prototypes. How are you guys coming?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (lying) We're close. Very close. 55 INT. CHASE’S LAB - DAY 55 CLOSE ON: MAYA’S EYES suddenly snapping open. Her face covered with a GREEN CREAM MASK.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Holy shit! What is that smell?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What the hell!? Oh my God, it’s burning! Maya runs to the sink and starts splashing water on her f

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s because it’s a hundred percent organic, as ordered.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Ugh. It smells like Chewbacca took a dump on my face.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Be honest, now. Don’t hold back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariana stands at the entrance as people pass... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can I ask some questions about your daily skin care routine...? Everyone ignores her. INT. Maya EXT. More EXT. WALMART - ANOTHER DAY Sy chats with a friendly customer...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I see, so then what do you look for in a sunblock?

dialogues.speaker: VALUE CLUB
dialogues.text: people blow past Ariana.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can I just ask you-- Okay. Have nice day.

dialogues.speaker: CVS
dialogues.text: Hildy talks to a customer who is overly made up.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Were you going for gaudy when you chose your make up today? The customer, offended, walks away. INT. CHASE’S LAB - DAY 60 Maya is wiping her face with a towel.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: The paraben chemicals are what make it smell better.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Can't do that. And what’11l make it a nicer color than vomit green?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Ethoxycinnimate-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Okay. Dumb it down for me? How do we get rid of the chemicals and still make it look and smell nice?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Find a biopolymer--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Dumber. More dumb.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: If you don’t want it to burn and smell like ass covered in bitch sauce, then we have to find the ingredients in nature.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Good. Start searching. (re: the green cream) Because we can’t market this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariana approaches a dapper gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Can I just-- The man literally shoves past her. She turns angrily and trips the first woman to walk past.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, are you okay? (helping the woman up) That dickhead just kept going.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Oh thank you dear.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Wow, your hands are so soft. What moisturizer do you use? 62 INT. RON’S OFFICE - DAY 62 Ron is looking at Maya’s resume on his desktop. He looks her Harvard accomplishments, and dials the number listed.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Office of the registrar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 63 Sis

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes, how do I verify if someone who says they went to Harvard actually graduated from there?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you have the name of the person and the year of graduation?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes, Maria Vargas. Class of ‘96.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Vargas, Maria. Yes she did, with honors. Magna Cum Laude. ANOTHER VOICE (0.S. Suck on that!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Excuse me? INT. DILLY’S DORM ROOM - STANFORD - SAME - INTERCUT: 63 Dilly is multi-tasking playing ‘Call Of Duty’ with his roommate - who shot him in the game. Dilly “shooshes” him Ron hangs

dialogues.speaker: DILLY
dialogues.text: Sorry, admissions gets excited when they ding a scholarship candidate.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (unsure) Uh, okay. Thank you. up, then looks at another name on Maya’s CV: Dilly screams at the video game, bouncing angrily on the couch. His phone lights up as it FALLS, UNSEEN, TO THE GROUND. We see Ron’s name appear on the screen, calling a new num with a prompt asking if Dilly wants to intercept the call After a five-second countdown, the call goes through.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE ON PHONE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Edward Taylor's office.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes, is Mr. Taylor in? I have a quick question about a reference on a former employee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE ON PHONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Taylor is on vacation for the next few weeks. I can have him return.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’d appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya sits at her desk, watching a YouTube video of the Rutgers baseball team winning the Big Ten Conference championship. Maya smiles as she sees Trey amidst a group of howling, 58. 63 64 champagne spraying players. She becomes wistful and start type an e-mail to him when suddenly-- Hildy drops a stack of research on Maya’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Research.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You did all of this? In the field?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus, no. We’ve wasted six weeks talking to nutjobs store to store. I ordered this from research.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: That’s not how we’re doing this.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: But it’s how it’s done. Ariana pulls one of the binders over and begins to peruse

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Wow, a hundred and twenty thousand responses, no real consensus on anything.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Which is exactly the point - people don’t know what they want. They want us to do the work for them so they can pick the prettiest bottle and get on with their lives. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maya? (Maya looks up) Do you have a second?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Uh. Sure. Maya walks over to Zoe who leads her out into the hallway

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: The head of our manufacturing company that we may merge with in China wants to meet me and Ron for dinner Thursday, and his English is sketchy. I was wondering if you might help me out.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (slightly confused) Okay. How?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Well, Dad doesn’t trust freelance translators and our in-house guy is on his honeymoon. The only employee we have who speaks Mandarin is-- Zoe stops, turns to Maya.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (knows what's coming) Me?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I’m kinda desperate. 65 INT. MAYA’S NEW APARTMENT - DAY 65 Joan is HOWLING with laughter. Then, barely able to speak

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You are so butt-fricked.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: This is not funny, Joan. I almost killed people in a boat race, and now I’m gonna murder Mandarin. I do not speak Chinese! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (still laughing) Fine. Then just tell the bitch she can blow you, respectfully.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’m serious. Joan pulls out her phone and starts searching for a numbe

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Okay. I’ve got an idea. Remember Dilly’s carpool friend, Kevin Chow, from computer camp?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: His father’s a vet. Caters to Chinese clientele. Fluent in Mandarin.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And how does that help me?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (dials) If this works, you will owe me big time.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: (perfect Mandarin) I haven't spoken in years. My pronunciation is spotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, Zoe, and Ron sit with Philip Jiang, of F&C China. A italics indicate - IN MANDARIN - SUBTITLED.

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: So you understand our concerns?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We do, and I must say our team is very eager to help you understand our process in any way we can, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: Call me Philip.  67 68 69 70 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where DR. DAVID CHOW and his CHINESE ASSISTANT are giving check up to a male Wiemeraner, while listening to Maya’s conversation and feeding her lines in Mandarin. Dogs howl in the background. It’s mayhem for poor Dr. Cho

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHOW, (IN ENGLISH)
dialogues.text: Okay, he’s asking if you have travelled extensively in China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Maya’s ear as she hears the translation.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (Mandarin) No. No I haven't been so fortunate as of yet.

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: You must come visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Chow holds the dog’s head and motions to his assistan as he multi-tasks the phone conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CHOW
dialogues.text: You say... (in Mandarin) I'd love to. (then, to his assistant, still in Mandarin) Check its scrotum.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin) I'd love to. Check its scrotum. Off Jiang’s confused look.

dialogues.speaker: CHOW, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (still to his assistant) Really, feel for any swelling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 Til 72

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Really, feel for any swelling. (then in English) But I feel badly we’re leaving everyone out of the conversation. I’m sure your English is better than my Mandarin.

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: I suspect it might be.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: We would love to schedule a tour for you and your colleagues to visit our facilities first hand.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But of course we have to wait until the deal is closed due to the proprietary nature of R&D.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: As long as there is a signed a non- disclosure agreement, I’m perfectly comfortable allowing Mr. Jiang to tour.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You may not be aware, Zoe, but that directly contradicts company policy. I’m sure Mr. Jiang can understand that. A tense beat at the table. Jiang looks at Maya.

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: (In Mandarin) Tell me. I'm having a tough time dealing with Ron. I like everyone at F&C, but I find him arrogant. What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Chow 1 ooks at the dog’s rear end and tells his assistant--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (listening to Dr. Chow) His anal glands need milking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jiang stares at Maya for a beat, then laughs hysterically

dialogues.speaker: JIANG
dialogues.text: (pointing to Maya) I like her. (looks to Zoe) And thank you, Zoe. I will gladly sign an NDA to tour the facilities. Ron looks humbled. Zoe looks at Maya, smiles appreciative

dialogues.speaker: JIANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shall we order? EXT. NEW YORK STREET - NIGHT ae Zoe and Maya walk alone.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Thank you. That actually worked out great.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Ron didn’t seem happy.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Ron’s only happy when someone else isnvt. (then) So, how’s your project coming?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Honestly? Slow. Wish I didn’t open my big mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Yeah, a hundred percent organic is tough. I took a run at it a few years ago. I still have a lot of data at my dad’s place. I moved out a few months ago, but if you don’t mind helping me dig for it, the research might save you a few headaches.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (taken aback) That actually would be... very helpful.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It's the least I can do for you making Ron look like a dick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 76 64. CONTINUED: vi) Off Maya’s smile. INT. ANDERSON CLARKE’S OFFICE - DAY 74 Anderson works at his desk. Zoe pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Hey Pop. Heading out a little early. I’m meeting Maya over at the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (closing the door) ) Actually, that’s why I wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Uh, oh. This sounds serious.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: There's something I need to tell you. EXT. ANDERSON’’S OFFICE - SAME 78 Through the window from the hallway, we see Anderson star tell Zoe something. She listens for a beat, then turns wh She steadies herself as he hands her a folder. She reads for a moment, then walks out on him. He doesn’t follow... EXT./INT. DAKOTA - ANDERSON’S APARTMENT - LATER 76 Zoe opens the door, she appears shaken and looks at Maya if at a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hey. She enters to find the beautiful apartment filled with mo boxes. Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When’s he moving? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (watching Maya) In a few weeks. My apartment in the Village is so tiny he let me keep a lot of my junk here.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: This place is... You grew up here?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Most of my life. As they walk down the hall there’s a picture of a young Z and a blonde woman.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Was that your mother? (Zoe nods) Beautiful. She was blonde?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was adopted. Maya nods. Zoe clocks it. Fit INT. ZOE’S BEDROOM - SAME 77 The room is a shrine to her childhood. Boxes are filled w piles of dolls, stacks of books, and homework assignments

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Sorry about the mess. Dad saved everything. She pulls out SpongeBob PJs that are half her size.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I mean, ‘everything.’ Maya smiles, pulls out a photo of Zoe dressed as Wonder W for Halloween with her two front teeth missing.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Could you be any cuter?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (smiles) This is the early stuff. (pulling out ziplocks) First haircut, first tooth, (beat) ...first blanket. It’s from my birth mother. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She hands a FADED BLANKET to Maya who takes it, her expression suddenly changing.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) It came with this. Zoe pulls out a FADED ENVELOPE. Maya’s face goes white, recognizing it. She looks up at Zoe in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It says...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (without reading) “I will always watch over you.” She looks up at Zoe with tears in her eyes. Zoe swallows hard. Tears fill her eyes as well.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You're my mother, aren't you? Maya backs away, overwhelmed by more than twenty years of fear and guilt surging through her.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just found out myself... It's several moments before Maya can begin to compose her and almost involuntarily, she steps to Zoe and hugs her h feeling Zoe’s shoulders and head with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Tears stream down Zoe’s face at Maya’s primal reaction. T part, then--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: My dad. I’m completely pissed at him... For years, after my mom died, I tried to find you. It was just a series of dead ends. I sorta gave up. But apparently he didn’t. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They walk. (2)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (laughing through tears) That was a good decision. Zoe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk, arm in arm.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Ask me anything.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Did you ever search for me?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The adoption agency advised me not to. You know, ‘don’t disrupt her new environment.’ But every time I’d see a little girl, I’d think is that what Sarah looks like now?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You called me Sarah? (Maya nods) So, I'd have been Sarah Rosalina de la Santa Cruz DaVilla Vargas?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You see why I shortened it.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Can I ask... What about my father?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I met him at party.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Does he know about me?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh baby, I never even knew his last name. (off Zoe) But he was the most beautiful boy I’d ever seen. 67. 77 78 79 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: He was?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And so sweet. (Zoe smiles) I was sixteen and basically on my own. But I knew you had to be born. Wasn’t even a question. I left school, got two jobs, but I had no one to watch you. They were going to take you away. Put you back in the system. I couldn’t let that happen. INT. ANDERSON’S HALLWAY - DUSK 80 PAN ACROSS dozens of framed pictures of the Clarkes. We see photos of Zoe as a toddler being carried by her adoptive mother; Zoe in braces; playing softball; with bo of her parents before the prom; standing with only father after graduating from Princeton. There’s love in every im Reveal Maya, standing alone, crying as she looks up at th photos - it’s everything she missed in Zoe's life.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I found my old research! Maya composes herself as Zoe walks through frame at the e of the hall carrying a box.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I took out the really good stuff cause I’m still gonna kick your ass. She smiles playfully and approaches Maya. ZOE (CONT’D) You okay? Maya nods, a lump in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. Let’s go, I’m starving. Maya takes one last look at the wall, then takes Zoe’s ha with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Me too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, we see Zoe and Maya sharing a sandwich and talking animatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya and Zoe continue to talk as they walk along the disp of planets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Zoe and Maya jog, Zoe steps on the gas, but Maya keeps Zoe smiles, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe has picked a tree way too big. She and Maya struggle carry it fireman style, laughing as they stumble. EXT./INT. JOAN’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 81 Joan walks in from the kitchen with a bottle of wine, top off Maya’s glass and sits with her on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: So that’s where you’ve been. I can’t believe it. I mean, it’s like out of a movie.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Joan.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You’re right. No super heroes. No one will give a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And please start cursing. (then) The last few days have been - amazing. She wants to get to know me.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: No kidding. She wants to make up for lost time.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: She wants to meet my friends.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Great. Love to.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: No. Not great. My “friends” from Harvard, and the Peace Corps who don’t actually exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson sits at lunch across from Maya and Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: I’d like to explain myself, to both of you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You don’t have to.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Oh yes, he does.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We used to say Zoe got her spirited streak from her mother, now we know that was only half true. (Maya laughs) When Zoe started looking for you, I didn’t know if it was healthy or not, but she wasn’t exactly asking my permission... After a while, she gave up, and... (to Zoe; quelling his emotions) .-.something went out in you. I know what your mother would have said, “Fix it, Andy,” so I kept the feelers out. (to Maya) And suddenly, almost magically, there you were online, formidably so. I had no idea if you’d want to have contact with Zoe, and I couldn't risk her being rejected, so, after reading your resume, I...

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Manipulated us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 Tar

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (he gestures, mea culpa) One day, god willing, you'll understand the lengths a parent will go to for their child’s happiness. Besides, for all I knew Maya could have been a serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Well, you still haven’t seen what’s in my basement.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (chuckles; then...) I did lie, though. To both of you. And for that I am sorry. Anderson takes Zoe’s hand as they smile at each other. Ma is affected by the deep love between them.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Listen guys, there’s something-- From behind them, we hear familiar voices.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maya? Is that Maria Maya Vargas? Reveal, Big Ant, Suzi, and Joan trying their best to look town.” Pants suits, hair done up, less make-up. BIG ANT (CONT’D) What are the odds?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: We were just on our way to the alumni social for Norton.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Wharton. (to Zoe & Anderson) Zoe, Anderson... these are my old friends from-- SuUzI Harvard. (extends her hand) Susan. Kennedy. Distant relation.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (extends her hand) Joan. London. No relation. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wan

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Maya who looks apoplectic) We did some time in the Peace Corps.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Big. Ant. No relation. (off their looks) -.-We saved whales.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (staring at Zoe) So, you're Maya’s little girl.

dialogues.speaker: SUZI
dialogues.text: She’s totally got your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So, guys. Where’s the mixer?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Upper West Side somewhere. Our driver has the 4-1-1.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: We just stopped in for a couple drinks and a tinkle.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: So we must go. Philanthropy never waits.

dialogues.speaker: SUZI
dialogues.text: Always saving something.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was an alumni social.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Three hours with drunk alums pawing at our checkbooks, we’ll be the ones who need saving. Anderson and Zoe laugh. Maya goes along with it painfully

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Isn't that always the truth. Well, nice to meet you ladies.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s lovely to finally meet some of Maya’s friends.  83 73. INT. MAYA’S OFFICE - DAY 83 Maya enters to find Chase and Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hi guys-- (off their excited looks) What? Hildy sets a stack of research on Maya’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: I found the hole!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: In the market. Here... He pushes a top sheet of data towards Maya.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (reading) Fruit?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Not just any fruit.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Tangerine... Huh.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Our data shows that there’s a thirty-seven percent increase in sales of any moisturizer, face cream or block with a citrus smell. And they’ve all been done, except

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Do you know what this means?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: We did it! Yes! But Maya still looks unsure.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Maya? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: (warning) We're at deadline.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I know. It’s just... none of our surveys gave us any indication that this really matters.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: We have to green light? Please?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) Okay. Hildy and Chase start celebrating. Maya seems unsure. EXT. HIGHL. Maya and J

dialogues.speaker: INE
dialogues.text: oan walk silently.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: So you're still mad at me for lunch? (Maya shrugs) She seems nice.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: So pretty too.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Unlike the bug up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh come on, Joan, “Save the whales?” really?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: She nailed it in rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why'd you spring that on me without checking?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: We were helping you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I wish you'd asked.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You said she wanted to meet your friends. (off Maya) So what, suddenly we don’t exist anymore? Be careful Maya, don’t confuse your new Facebook thing with who you really are.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: My daughter thinks I’m this amazing person, what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Try telling her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And ruin everything, are you crazy? Maybe once we've gotten to know each other more.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You once said the exact same thing about Trey.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (Joan’s right, but--) That's a shitty thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: If the shite fits.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You have no idea what it’s been like. You have NO idea how many times a day I still thought about her! Is she okay? Is she happy? Is she even alive?... And now, you're right, I've found her and it’s all messed up, I’m a mess, and I hate the lie but I have to be the person she thinks I am or I will definitely lose her and I cannot survive that again.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You act like you don’t have a choice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Then I guess it’s too bad she’ll never meet the old Maya; she was an amazing person. Joan walks off. INT. MAYA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 85 Maya sits alone in her apartment, several iterations of t ‘green line’ and stacks of data lie on the coffee table. Unable to concentrate, she leans back and sighs, looking around the apartment that, somehow, doesn’t seem so grand anymore. INT. MAYA’S OFFICE - DAY 86

dialogues.speaker: HOLD EVERYTHING
dialogues.text: Ariana bursts in holding a flash drive. Maya, Hildy and C look up from their work.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Please don’t shout.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: (to Maya; dizzy from the view) Before we ran down Hildy’s tangerine road I wanted to make sure we're good.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: We're not. She closes her eyes and “bravely” inches her way over to Maya’s desk, holding out the flash drive.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Oh, for the love of god. She grabs the flash drive and hands it to Maya who puts i into her computer. Up comes graphics for-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tah’

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: (eyes still closed) Ponds just announced they’re putting out a whole Tangerine skin care line. And it’s green.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: They beat us to the punch?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Who cares. For every Pepsi there’s a Coke. I say we stay the course. Ariana starts backing away...

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: The board will never go for it. Especially if they’re out first. We've been burned in marketing wars before. They want originality.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Originality. So... you’re saying--

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: We’re done. We’re out of time. Hildy slumps on the couch. Maya feels terrible.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry guys. She grabs her coat and walks out. 87 INT. VALUE CLUB - TRIPLE M’S - DAY 87 The back room overflows with MMM’s. Maya walks in, unsett

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Oh, look who came to the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: You mean down off the mountain. suziI What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (thinking she came clean) They fired you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Might as well have. Nine weeks of work, and we just got beat by another company doing the same damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: SUZI
dialogues.text: Well, everything happens for a reason, right? (off Maya’s look) You’re with your daughter again.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Who’s gorgeous, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you guys for the other day. It was a little pathetic, but very sweet... (teasing) Mostly pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: I know, I went with whales, should’a said frogs. Gotta listen to my gut more.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Me too. I let myself get talked into data and spreadsheets when I should have stuck with what got me there. There's just so many products, so much competition. Too much noise.

dialogues.speaker: SUZI
dialogues.text: When there’s too much noise in the car from the kids screaming, I lay on the horn. Eeeeeeeehh! Shuts ‘em right up every time.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: If only there was a skin-care equivalent.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: One thing to cut through the noise... One thing to... Omigod, that’s it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: suzI What?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You guys are amazing, I love you, I gotta go. She runs out. Joan shakes her head, disappointed in Maya.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: (to Suzi) What you don’t realize about the horn thing, is your kids duck down in the back seat, and you look like a crazy lady driving alone with your horn blowing. Off Suzi...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: One product?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is on the phone. Screaming.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yes! That does the job of all three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: We should run it by Hildy to check the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Forget the numbers. That’s what got us in this mess in the first place. I got a good feeling about this. We're making one product that does everything. Rejuvenates, blocks the sun, moisturizes the whole body. I mean think about it, how ridiculous is it that we have a different cream for every body part. It’s stupid.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: So I can use it for my jock itch? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (a beat) Okay, so there’ll still be two creams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya and Chase walk as he eats a hot dog from the cart.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Maya, SPF formulas that block the sun and stay on your skin are synthetic and can actually be poisonous. You don’t want people sleeping in it. Plus we only have three weeks left.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: But, isn’t there a natural compound that gives sun protection and isn’t poisonous?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You're talking a biopolymer with a sun resistant, organic component?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: It doesn’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yet. If we can put everything into one product instead of three, and keep it green? That’s a game changer. No one is doing that. Chase shakes his head ‘not possible.’

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chase, I believe in you. (checks her watch) Shit, we'll make a quick stop at the Christmas party, and then we’1ll hit the lab. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She tries hailing a cab, but Chase hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I can’t go.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: It's for executives only. Maya approaches him. Knows what it feels like not to belo

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Gimme a break. You're my date. And Ariana too. It’s on the top floor, she’ll be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decorated for Christmas, the F&C executive holiday party in full swing with an 8 piece band. Maya, in a black dress, hair up, comes in with Chase who’ stuffed into an ill-fitting suit. Maya can tell he’s nerv

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: There’s a reason I was banished to cat food. Not good at these things. Chase grabs a glass of wine off a waiter’s tray and downs

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Why did Felix banish you?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) The whole Novalis scandal was Felix’ idea. He wanted me to cheat the readings to hide the fact we were repackaging shampoo as a hair growth product. But I wouldn’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So he let you keep your job if you kept quiet, but sent you to Siberia. (off Chase’s painful nod) So why didn’t you quit? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl CONTINUED: 91

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Because that’s what he wants. Maya sees Felix at the bar with Ron, who raises his drink Maya smirks back.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well if it isn’t Team Green. Maya turns to see Zoe, looking fantastic. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Zoe, wow. You look amazing.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Thanks. Pretty damn fine yourself. They’re unsure how to greet each other, settle for a hug semi-cheek-kiss. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did any of that research help?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (cryptically) Who's asking, my rival or my--

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Your daughter. Maya smiles at the warmth, once again feeling pangs of gu Anderson approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Well, I seem to have found the cool crowd. (quietly) And two of the most beautiful people here.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Thank you. (then realizing) Right.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (offers his hand to Maya) Shall we? They start to dance just as Felix sidles up to Chase. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I believe the party for the lower- level employees is down at Chili’s.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I came with Maya.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Ah, well, enjoy this while you can. Word is you'll be back to cat food soon enough. 83. 91 Chase spots Ariana standing nervously at the entrance. Ignoring Felix, he walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: You look pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I'm actually surprised you made it off the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: I just barfed into my purse. She hands the small, closed clutch to Chase.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: I see. Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Of course. He starts to undo his tie, leading her away from the floor. As they pass Felix, Chase hands him the purse.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Hold this for a sec. Confused, Felix reaches for the purse’s zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dance 92 Anderson and Maya dance. He can tell she’s conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: You okay? Maya nods. They watch Zoe dancing “The Shopping Cart” wit group of co-workers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Is she happy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Happier... (off Maya) F&C was never her ambition, but she came to work right out of college. I shouldn’t have let her but I was selfish and we were both hurting and... But now she needs to go and live a life, and fall in love, forget about the old man for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Is it awkward to say thank you? In my dreams I couldn’t have asked for... You and Cynthia both did an incredible job with her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (touched) She’s the love of our lives. They admire Zoe, dancing and laughing and young.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hail to the Chief. Ron dances with Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Anderson) Everything good with China?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Apparently your dinner went well. Jiang was so impressed with our facilities that he wants to make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Fantastic. I knew once he saw them, he'd be in. (cuts off Maya before she can contest the lie) Maya really helped me to convey that to Mr. Jiang. Anderson is pleased. Ron gives Maya a “you owe me one” lo which is echoed by Hildy. Zoe, who’s dancing nearby, witnesses this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (steely) Happy to help.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Look who finally showed up. Samuel Weiskopf, from Value Club comes over. Anderson sto dancing to greet him as Maya blanches.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (they shake hands) Hello, Sam. Of course you know Maya from her time consulting for you at Value Club.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL WEISKOPF
