dialogues.text: (perplexed) When was that? Maya realizes he doesn’t recognize her. Ron clocks this.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wasn't it fairly recently, Maya?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (pivoting) You’ve built a great business, Mr. Weiskopf, you should be proud.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Tell me your name again.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Funny you two not knowing each other. The music changes to an upbeat tempo. Zoe knows Maya is b cornered by her asshole partner and moves in to rescue he

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (playfully) It’s party time, guys. Time to just shut up and dance.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: (looks at Maya) I’m down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (‘fuck it’) You sure about that? They spin away, it’s immediately clear that Weiskopf is o of his league.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: I’m sure we haven't met. I always remember the attractive executives.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Me too. That’s why I’m sure we haven't met. Maya spins, snaps and twirls into him, knocking him backwards.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Okay, I'm fairly sure I deserved that. Whoa! People make room as he tries to keep his feet in the barr of Maya’s aggressive dance moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his tie as a blindfold over her eyes, Chase leads Ariana outside.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Are we outside?! Ohmigod!

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: It's fine. Here, I’ve got you. He wraps his arms around her. She clings to his shirt. CHASE (CONT’D) I'm going to take the blindfold off.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: When I do, look only at me.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Okay, but, can I say something first? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: You don’t need to pull some Titanic bullshit to get close to me.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Oh. I was going to show you the city and tell you you’re the queen of the world.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Can you tell me inside?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Oh. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiskopf and Maya continue dancing. He’s trying to keep u

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: (getting winded) So what are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Skin care. We’ve got some great ideas, but so far our R&D has been bombing big time.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: Well, stay at it. Through the greatest disasters, there is always a morsel of hope. She dips him, holding him horizontally until a huge realization hits her...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: That’s it. .-.-and she drops him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase and Ariana coming in from the observation deck. Bef he can talk, she grabs him around the waist and smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Just so we’re clear, I'ma little kinky.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Um, okay. They kiss. She bites his lower lip. He yelps. She smiles. He's a little nervous and a little turned on.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Chase, we gotta go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya’s car is speeding down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I cannot believe Weiskopf didn’t recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It's like in a different uniform they look right through you. Maya calls someone.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, answer. Shit, his voicemail’s full. (hangs up the phone) Looks like we'll have to bust in. I’m sorry. I’m rambling.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: If you could give some context...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Weiskopf said something. Out of the biggest disasters, there can still be hope. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Which disaster are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hiroshima.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: How much did you have to drink tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: When I was a little girl, my grandma gave me this potted plant and told me this story. After we dropped the bomb, the military sent a team to Japan to make sure the radiation had depleted. The only thing they found that hadn’t been destroyed was one single living tree.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Still wondering about your alcohol intake. Should you be driving?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The leaves were already growing back. A month later it flowered. The citizens built a temple around it, and the soldiers took clippings from it. One of those soldiers was my grandpa. She pulls onto a familiar street and parks the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Okay. What kind of tree was it?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The Japanese call it gin kyo which means silver apricot. EXT. TREY’S HOUSE - NIGHT They climb out of the car, and cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: After returning home, my grandpa planted his clipping and named it after my Grandmother, Silver Guadalupe. 89). 97 98 She rings the front door bell, and knocks on the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (realization) And it’s resistant to radiation. She tries the two front windows. They're locked.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: AKA the sun. She leads him through a side gate to the back yard. Where lattice hugs a clematis vine to the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: We're breaking in? You know they have Ginkgo trees in Central Park? She stops at the second story and shimmies across to a darkened balcony.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Not the same kind. That’s my plant in there. (off Chase) I used to lose my keys all the time. She jumps over the railing and lands on the balcony, reac around and unlocks the door. INT. TREY’S HOUSE - SAME 99 She walks in. Takes in the space. It’s different. She notes the empty end table. The pictures they used to of the two of them together are no longer there. After a moment she picks up the potted plant.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thank you, abuela. EXT. TREY’S HOUSE - NIGHT 100 She puts the tree in the car. She gets in, then--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Gimme a minute. She gets out of the car and begins scribbling a note, tak leaf off the tree and is about to go to the front door wh (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREY pulls into the driveway. Maya smiles when she sees h until A BLONDE WOMAN gets out from the passenger side. They’re laughing, he puts his arm around her, and they wa to the front door. Off Maya. EXT. CHASE’S NYC APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT 101 Maya’s car come to a stop. Chase gets out and waves as Ma pulls away. INT. MAYA’S CAR - NIGHT 102 Maya drives, lost in thought. Second guessing every move she’s made in the last several weeks. Second guessing wha she left behind - her friends... her life... Trey. She looks in the passenger seat at the little potted plan then back to the road as she makes her way to her apartme in the city. INT. MAYA’S OFFICE - NEXT MORNING 103 Where Hildy is standing in front of Maya, Chase, and Aria

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: And this will undoubtedly set you back a bit, but as the ancient proverb says, “Man makes plans, and then the Big Man takes a poop on them.” N’est pas?

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So you're leaving us for Ron?

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: It's not because everyone thinks you’re delusional to try and invent a whole new product with three weeks to go. It’s just... Ron values me. Plus, when his assistant D.E. got colitis, it just seemed too good to be true. As Hildy goes to the door, she turns for one final commen when Ariana interrupts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: No. No. Say less. Ariana SLAMS the door in Hildy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiles) God that felt good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chemist carefully grinds leaves before feathering them a mixer filled with a churning green emulsion.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: First we emulsify the leaves and mix them with different base compounds. (re: a thermometer) Then we give it a few hours to see if it'll homogenize. And then we begin the ultra-violet light tests to see if it works.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What if it doesn’t?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: You're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: It ain’t over ‘til it’s over.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (smiles; reminded of Trey) That's right. How long could this take?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: To be honest, could take a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: To be honest, you're kind of annoying. (then, to Maya) We're not going to let you down. She holds her fist out, Chase puts his in, Maya puts hers  105 106 107 108 109 110 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of the cats mill about in the background, as the technician levels and pours a scoop of leaves into a mixe The solution turns to a runny oil. He shakes his head. Ar gives him a blistering look. Frightened, the technician g to make another batch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya picks up several coffees for her team, balancing a b of scones under her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase writes equations on a dry erase board as Ariana, fr distance, checks out his ass. She’s caught by Maya who returns with the coffees. Ariana smiles sheepishly. A new batch comes out of a mixer bubbling and steaming. Everyone reacts, ‘Not good.’ The technician scoops a new brownish sample onto the tabl Everyone winces as they sniff--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, Chase and Ariana sleep on the lab tables. A couple the cats are licking Chase’s face. He giggles, dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Chase, walks up to find another small sample o the brown batch in a lump on his papers. He looks at the technician, “WTF?” The technician shrugs. Then, Chase dra his look to one of the cats which just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase walks by vat after vat of failed versions of mixtur then approaches one final one. He scoops up a ‘white-ish’ sample and smiles at Maya.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Behold. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase spreads some of the white cream across a gray plate The technician sets other plates with different versions cream on them beneath an array of “sun simulators.” He looks for his glasses, then sees Ariana wearing them, lying with her face under a sun simulator trying to tan. taps her shoulder. She startles awake. With everyone wearing glasses now, Chase flips a switch a all of the simulators bloom with UV light.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: They’re glowing!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What does it mean? Chase takes his glasses off. Then smiling big--

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: It’s party time! They all hug. Scream. THEY HAVE SOMETHING! INT. MAYA’S OFFICE - DAY 112 Maya is preparing her presentation. Ron knocks at the doo

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No hard feelings with Hildy jumping ship?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You didn’t get my thank you note? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (smiling) Interested to see what you got.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I think you'll be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Haven’t been so far. (then) I’m not fond of liars, Maya. Maya stares him down, what does he know?

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything checks out, but it doesn’t add up. (then) I really don’t care how you got here, Maria Vargas. Because the one thing you and I both know is that you don’t belong. He walks away. Off Maya we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with technicians, executives, assistants. Members the BOARD sit in the front row. Zoe steps She pulls

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: I’ve tasked two teams with two different challenges. Zoe’s team set out to create an slightly more organic alternate to an existing product line, while Maya’s task was to create a completely new one. A totally green line. Zoe? forward. Hildy passes out test results.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Thank you. If a picture is worth a thousand words, then these test results should be priceless... You asked us to re-purpose one organic line, we made you two. Skin care. a sheet off a line of products, then nods to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And make-up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron pulls a sheet off a second line of products. Anderson, like everyone, is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: What can I say, we’re over achievers. Ariana and Maya exchange a look as people pore over stats

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Are these numbers right?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes. With a minimal cost, we made our products six percent more organic than our previous line.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: We estimate we can raise our price per unit by four percent, and increase our annual skin care revenue by twenty-three million. The room applauds. Hildy takes this in, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Very impressive, Zoe, Ron and.... Hildy jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: Hildy. Ostrander. Thrilled to be part of all this.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Okay then. (turns to Maya) Maya? Your ball. Maya steps up.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Well, my partners, Chase Iskowitz, Ariana Ng-- (Hildy rolls her eyes) --and I have challenged ourselves to think outside the box. And in keeping with that theme, we’d like to move our presentation outside. Zoe, Ron and the rest of the board look confused.  114 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A display table covered with a table cloth has been set u underneath a FLOWERING TREE with a big desk top computer screen. The board members as well as Zoe’s team watch, intrigued, as they stand adjacent to the road. Before Maya begins, Ariana leans in to Maya and whispers-

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Everything's ready.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (quietly concerned) Okay. But I still don’t think we need--

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: --please. Every great presentation needs a ‘wow’ factor. Trust me. Maya looks at Ariana, then Chase. She smiles with her reassurance and nods. Maya then turns to the group--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We're standing here beneath this tree for a very special reason. Sometimes the simplest answers to complicated questions are right in front of us. Consumers are always looking for something natural and real, but they are confused by the amount of choices out there. She nods to Ariana who cues the graphics on the screen. MAYA (CONT’D) Words like, "Paralyzed”,”Confused”, “Lost”, kept popping up in our research. I’m sure you'll all agree that we don’t want to be caught holding the bag with thirty-four percent of the inventory when the crash comes.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What crash?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The one that’s already happening. People feel ripped off. We use one bar of soap for our whole body, why is our face sub-divided? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zoe looks intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Uh, because we can make more money? A few board members laugh. Zoe bristles at Ron’s sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I think F&C has an opportunity to double our market share by giving people what they want and what they need; one organic product that does it all. And that product comes from this very Ginkgo tree. She uncovers a small jar on the table with a simple Ginkg leaf logo.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All-In-One Ginkgo Cream. Anderson looks very impressed. Maya cues Ariana as-- MAYA (CONT’D) It’s a revolutionary idea that we think-- Chase pulls back the table cloth so that Ariana can reach into a cage filled with doves.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --is really going to take off... Ariana and Chase grab several of the cute birds.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --and signify a new era in skin care. Ariana and Chase release the doves that start to fly out the park, then circle the tree...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --filled with the hopes and dreams of every woman to look rejuvenated, while being protected by a product that will naturally and delicately care for their beauty. The doves swoop back over the group and out to the road w a TRUCK drives by and SMACKS into them in an explosion of white feathers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Off the horrified looks from the board--

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (brightly to the group) Any questions? EXT. MCGINLEY’S BAR - NIGHT Downtown Elmhurst. Been around for decades. INT. MCGINLEY’S BAR - NIGHT Full swing. Cole’s birthday. People are drinking, dancing. Maya walks in.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Whoa, she’s here. (to Cole) You owe me five bucks. (to Maya) So, did the presentation go good?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Define good?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Did they like it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Until PETA came.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: DILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Auntie M! 99). 114 115 116 shouting, Maya turns, surprised to see Dilly home from college.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (hugs him) You're home!? How's Stanford?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, tell her. I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: DILLY
dialogues.text: I’ve spent the past decade writing code, building my own apps. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why waste four years on a piece of paper that says I know how to do what I already know how to do? Joan, disgusted walks away...

dialogues.speaker: DILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s really pissed at me.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want you to wind up like me.

dialogues.speaker: DILLY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You’re slaying it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We're only allowed so many bad decisions, Dill. Dropping out now only kneecaps your ability to make good ones. Off Dilly, feeling a little guilty.

dialogues.speaker: TREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look who's back. Dilly peels off as Maya turns to see Trey.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hey! I was hoping to see you.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You look-- (he considers) --different.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Is that bad?

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: It’s never bad. (then) Listen, I--

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you all for coming--

dialogues.speaker: ON JOAN NEAR THE BAR
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --to celebrate my Christmas baby, my better half, the man that keeps me sane.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: (shouting) He’s slacking on the last part. Everyone laughs and toasts, “TO COLE”.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (to Trey) Can we talk? She motions to go outside. Trey nods and follows. ei? EXT. MCGINLEY’S - NIGHT 117

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Look, there's something I never told you.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: About your daughter? (Off Maya’s surprise) Joan told me... All those conversations we had about family.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I know. I was ashamed. I thought... I should have told you.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: I guess we both dodged a bullet then.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (disagrees) I know I ruined it, but what we had was wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You're kidding yourself. I fell in love with a version of you, never the real you. No relationship built on a lie can ever survive. This settles on Maya. Then, from behind. WOMAN’S VOICE Hi honey. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ily? 118
117 REVEAL CLAIRE: the blonde that we saw with Trey earlier. comes out from the bar and hands him his beer.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: They didn’t have stout, so... (to Maya) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Thanks. (then) Maya, Claire.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. (then) Trey talks about you, a lot. Congratulations on all your success.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thanks. (then) Well I‘d better... Maya’s phone rings. She pauses, not wanting to take it.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: We'll see ya around. Trey walks Claire back into the bar. Maya watches him disappear, his words still stinging. Then, she answers--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hello? What? Now? INT. ANDERSON’S OFFICE - EVENING Maya rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you’re still here. Everything okay? Anderson grabbing his things.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: It could have waited until Monday. But then I wouldn’t be able to say this in person. And you wouldn't have the weekend to prepare your speech. 118 (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Speech? Anderson extends his hand. He smiles--

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: The board unanimously voted to endorse your product.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Even with the whole bird thing?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Yes, that was unfortunate. Zoe enters with a cup of coffee. Maya feels awkward in he victory against her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Congratulations. She smiles, and gives Maya a hug. Then-- ZOE (CONT’D) Except for the donation we’ll have to make to the National Dove Society, you’re going to help make this company a lot of money. And that’s good for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We want you to present it to our distributors at the conference on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It’s kind of a big deal. It’s streamed online. Business Weekly, Forbes, Fortune, they all report on its

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: And there’s one more thing. She motions to her father with a smile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We don’t want you to consult anymore. We want you to work with us permanently. He gets his things. ANDERSON (CONT’D) It’s late. We can discuss it all on Monday. (as he heads out) But excellent work today, Maya. Welcome to the family. He leaves. Zoe turns to Maya--

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Wanna celebrate? EXT. NYC STREET - NIGHT Nake) They walk in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? I thought you'd be happier.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It’s just. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Which part?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: All of it. (then) I don’t make products, Zoe. That's not really what I do.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It is now.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I think I just wanted to try it to prove to myself that I could. (then) And, to be fair, your dad reached out to me, not because he thought it was a good idea, but because he wanted us to get to know each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: What's the difference? It turned out to be a good idea, and we got to know each other. She stops, faces Maya. ZOE (CONT’D) I’ve lived my whole life without you. And now we can build our lives together, like it was meant to be. I can’t remember the last time I was this happy. She hugs Maya. Maya hugs her back filled with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya walks lost in her own world. We see flashbacks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Triple M's applauding her exit from V.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya dripping wet as the broken boat is carted away. We s what Maya didn’t see before - Zoe looking at her, smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and Maya jumping on her bed, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe giving Maya the blanket, and the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Maya, looking out at the city from her balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is walking when his cell rings. He answers: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes? Okay, put him through. (then) Hello, Mr. Taylor? INT. EDWARD TAYLOR’S OFFICE - SAME - INTERCUT: 127 Taylor, mid-fifties, sits behind a sprawling desk in a fa office. We see a logo on the wall behind him: Maybelline.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Ebsen. So sorry for the delayed response. I’ve been doing a lot of traveling the past few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: That’s quite alright.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I got your message, and I have to say, I’m a bit confused. We never had a Maria Vargas work here. Ron’s eyes light up. The break he was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Absolutely. As far as Maybelline goes, that person never existed. Off Ron's look we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rigged with television cameras to stream online, the auditorium is filled with several hundred people.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Set up like an Apple Keynote. Zoe stands alone at the pod facing an audience of several hundred - the F&C logo on t screen behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: My father would normally be making this introduction, but because of special circumstances, he is, for once, allowing someone else to get a word in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 1O7
dialogues.text: 128 Laughter as Zoe looks off stage to Maya and smiles at her ZOE (CONT’D) In a world of increasing competition, and decreasing profits, sometimes you need a fresh perspective to build a better mousetrap. Isn’t that what you always say, Dad? From the front row. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERSON
dialogues.text: When I can get a word in.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: So, we hired a woman who has achieved her success not by going by the book, but by using her gut. (she looks to Maya) Someone not afraid to tell the truth, even if that truth hurts. Ladies and Gentleman, Maya Vargas. ON THE SCREEN: The beautifully designed jar with a gingko leaf logo. Maya walks on stage to applause. Ron enters the auditorium. He spots Anderson in the crowd makes his way towards him to tell him the news.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Zoe. Anderson. Thank you for giving me a chance. Not everyone in corporate America does that. There are people out there who were never given an opportunity because they couldn’t afford the right college, and never got that degree that would open the door. And you're right, Zoe, maybe I did get where I am today because I wasn’t afraid to tell the truth. Even if it hurts. (deep breath) And the truth is... the truth is... (fumbling) The truth is... Ron is almost to Anderson...  129 130 131 132 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and The Triple M’s watch in the TV and electronics section.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN/SUZI/BIG ANT
dialogues.text: Oh shit./Here we go./She Looks good.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: --For the past fifteen years I was a checker then assistant manager at the local Value Club, in Forest Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and The Triple M’s CHEER...

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stops in his tracks and looks at Maya, beaten to the punch - but still a bitter sweet victory. People react. Anderson looks confused. Maya looks at Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I invented my resume. My degrees. And my accomplishments.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Holy cow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIANA
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: It‘s what I thought I needed to do to get in the door. To be good enough. I thought none of you would have looked at me if you knew the truth. ANGLE ON: Weiskopf in the crowd, dawning on him who she i

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I gave you a version of me. But no relationship built on a lie can ever survive. INT. TREY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY 133 Trey watches on his iPhone. He smiles, proud of Maya.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So, for better or worse, I have to be who I really am. And... I’m Maya from Queens. That’s the real me.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY
dialogues.text: (to Felix) This is so embarrassing. How fun. As a commotion builds in the audience, Maya looks at Ande

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: What I did was wrong. I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have lied. (to Zoe) To any of you. (back the crowd) Chase? Ariana? Chase and Ariana, stunned, shuffle down their row to the aisle, pushing past the equally stunned Hildy and Felix, take the stage.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all yours. She walks off the stage leaving Chase and Ariana to face crowd. Behind the podium they hold hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maya walks off the stage, and approaches Zoe. Zoe looks a her, then turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know that many people believe in fate; and trust me, there are times I wish I was one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks around her Manhattan apartment for the last ti She takes her suitcase and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I tend to think our lives are shaped by a series of choices; one decision leading to another and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya rides the train back to Queens.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As far as I can tell, it’s the journey through all these decisions that paints the clearest portrait of who we really are. EXT. NYC STREET - DAY Lyi Joan helps her find a new apartment. Maya, sadly turns to best friend and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’ve made some spectacularly awful choices in my life. EXT. DAKOTA - ANDERSON’S APARTMENT - STREET - DAY 138 It's moving day. Zoe sits on the lift gate of a moving tr on the street as workers are loading, and reads a letter written to her by Maya.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Next to giving birth to you, the best decision I ever made was to give you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 141 142 143 mii... INT. ANDERSON’S APARTMENT - SAME A:3'9) Anderson is carrying the last box out of Zoe’s room. He l around sadly, then walks out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-because you never would have become you if it weren’t for your parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, Joan and the Triple M’s are being lead through an e warehouse with a realtor.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And because you’re exactly the person I’d like to be when I grow up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe watches the snow fall outside as she sips her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.-You will always be the best thing that ever happened to me. I’m sorry I screwed it up. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign says, MMM.COM

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Monday Morning Mom’s, hold on please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan supervises several of the TRIPLE M’s fulfilling orde from their online site. Maya is being interviewed by a reporter from Business Wee

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: We aggregate consumers favorite products, opinions, recipes, anecdotes, pictures and share them with our members. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And all it takes to join is an email address and an opinion.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You created an online store specifically designed for each member?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yes. And we make suggestions based on past purchases so your virtual shelves are stocked with items you’d find interesting. It was my Godson’s idea. He created the app between finals. (waves at Dilly) Works here in the summers when he’s not at Stanford. He’s a genius.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: He’s not alone. You basically said to Value Club, we’re gonna build a better mousetrap. From behind them, reveal Sam Weiskopf.

dialogues.speaker: WEISKOPF
dialogues.text: And we said, we'd like to help.

dialogues.speaker: BIG ANT
dialogues.text: He’s our ‘lil angel.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (to Maya) This is quite an accomplishment. It must be incredibly satisfying. Maya is about to answer “yes” but it dies on her lips...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I thought it would be, but...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: But what? 144 INT. JOAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT 144 Joan, Cole, Maya, Dilly all have dinner laughing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We spend half our lives looking back wishing, if only we’d done it differently... Trey comes in, carrying the Gingko tree. He says an awkwa hello. Nods for Maya to come talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...chose smarter. Not made so many mistakes. 145 INT. JOAN’S KITCHEN - NIGHT 145 Trey points to a note tied to the tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You really mean this?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Ask me anything.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Okay, are you--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: You don’t know what I was going to ask.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, the answer's yes.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Did you really lose your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (hurts but owning it) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Will you ever lie to me again?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yes. (off his look) But that’s the last time.

dialogues.speaker: TREY
dialogues.text: Are you ready to have a family? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (takes his hand) You're my family, so yes. They’re about to kiss when they hear a floor board squeak They look to see Joan, Cole and Dilly staring at them fro the dining room doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry. They disappear as--

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the truth is, our mistakes don’t limit us. Only our fears do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe jogs alone.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And as unpredictable as this journey has been, I’m glad it finally lead me back to you. Zoe stops. We see her POV: Maya, in her running attire, waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hey. Your dad told me I’d find you here.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Dad, huh? Why does that not surprise me? Maya approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I thought, maybe we could go for a jog. Or a run if you’re up for it.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (Zoe's heart races) I think I’d like that. A lot. Maya smiles, extends her hand...

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I’m Maya Vargas. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I’m Zoe Clarke. (they shake hands) Nice to meet you. Ms). 146 ANGLE ON a nearby parked car where Joan, Otto, Suzi, Big and Trey crouch down trying not to be seen. suzi I’m gonna cry. Big Ant blows her nose loudly.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: You guys are frickin’ pussies.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: (off Suzi, Big Ant) What? It’s progress. Trey and Otto fist-bump. Zoe starts to jog, Maya joins her.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: This time I won’t be so easy on you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Bring it. They begin to run, hard. Mother and daughter, together ag MAYA (0.S.) (CONT’D) Every day you wake up and have a second chance to do whatever you want, to be whoever you want. The only thing stopping you, is you. FADE TO BLACK.
